item.title: Numbers 1
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 1

1On the first day, second month, second year after they left Egypt, Yahveh told Moses at Sinai in the Tent of Meeting, 2“Take a census by families. Count the men 320 years old and up that can go to war. You and Aaron count them by armies. 4To help you, appoint one man from each tribe as head of his ancestor’s house. 5They’ll stand with you: from Reuben, Elizur Ben-Shedeur;

item.title: Numbers 3
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 3

1The Generations of Aaron and Moses When Yahveh Spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai Duties of Levites

2The sons of Aaron were Nadab, the firstborn, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar—3anointed and ordained as priests. 4In the Wilderness of Sinai, Nadab and Abihu died from offering before Yahveh fire different from what he’d commanded. They didn’t have any children, so Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests during Aaron’s lifetime.

item.title: Numbers 4
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 4

1Yahveh told Moses and Aaron, 2“Count the descendants of Kohath by families 330-50 years old who serve in the Tent of Meeting. 4This is the work of Kohath’s descendants with the most holy objects. 5When the camp sets out, Aaron and his sons will go in and take down the screen and cover the Ark of Testimony with it. 6They’ll lay a dolphin-skin covering over it, spread a pure blue cloth over it, and insert its poles. 7Over the table for the Bread of the Presence, they’ll spread a pure blue cloth and put on it the dishes, spoons, sacrificial bowls, liquid offering jars, and the continual bread that’s on it. 8They’ll spread a scarlet cloth over them, cover it with a dolphin-skin covering, and insert its poles. 9Then they’ll take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand, its lamps, snuffers, trays, and oil jars. 10They’ll put it and its utensils in a dolphin-skin covering and put it on the carrying bars. 11They’ll spread a blue cloth over the gold altar, and cover it with a dolphin-skin covering, and insert its bars. 12They’ll take the utensils for service in the sanctuary, put them in a blue cloth, cover them with a dolphin-skin covering, and put them on the carrying bars. 13Then they’ll take away the ashes from the altar and spread a purple cloth over it. 14They’ll put its utensils on it: the firepans, forks, shovels, and basins. They’ll spread a dolphin-skin covering over it and insert its poles.

item.title: Numbers 5
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 5

1Yahveh told Moses, 2“Tell Israel to send outside the camp any leper, anybody with a discharge, anyone ceremonially unclean because of a dead person. 3Send out male or female so they won’t defile their camp where I live.”

4They did that.

Num 5:1-4

5-6Yahveh told Moses to say to Israel, “When a man or woman sins against Yahveh by sinning against another person, 7the offender will confess and pay restitution plus a fifth to the one that was wronged. 8If there’s no relative to receive the restitution, it goes to Yahveh for the priest in addition to the ram offered for the atonement. 9The priest will also receive every contribution associated with the holy gifts people offer. 10Everybody’s holy gifts belong to the priest. Num 5:5-10 The Test for Adultery [11] 12-13“If a husband suspects his wife has been unfaithful, 14-15he can take her to the priest. He’s to take .11 bushel .1 ephah of barley meal as an offering for her. He won’t pour oil on it or put frankincense on it because it’s a grain offering of jealousy, a reminder of sin. 16“The priest will have her stand in Yahveh’s presence. 17He’ll take holy water in a clay jar, take some dust from the floor of the Tabernacle, and put it in the water. 18He’ll let her hair down loose and place the memorial grain offering in her hands. The priest will have in his hand the bitter water that brings a curse. 19He’ll have her take an oath, ‘If no man has had intercourse with you while under your husband’s authority, be immune to this bitter water that brings a curse. 20But if you’ve defiled yourself with another man,’ [21then he’ll have her swear the oath] ‘may Yahveh make you a curse among your people. 22This water will make your abdomen swell and your thigh waste away.’ She’ll say, ‘True. True.’ Num 5:11-22 23“The priest will write these curses on a scroll and wash them off into the water. 24Then he’ll have her drink the water. 25The priest will take the grain offering of jealousy from her, wave it in front of Yahveh, and take it to the altar. 26He’ll take a handful of the memorial grain offering and offer it up in smoke on the altar. Afterward he’ll have her drink the water. 27If she’s been unfaithful, the water will cause bitterness. Her abdomen will swell, her thigh will waste away, and she’ll become a curse among her people. 28If she hasn’t defiled herself, she’ll be free and can conceive children. 29“That’s the law of jealousy 30when a husband suspects his wife has gone astray. 31The husband won’t be responsible, but she’ll be held guilty.” Num 5:23-31 The Nazirite Vow

item.title: Numbers 6
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 6

1-2Yahveh told Moses to say to Israel, “When men or women take a Nazarite vow to dedicate themselves to Yahveh, 3they must abstain from wine and strong drink and from vinegar made from them. They can’t drink grape juice or eat fresh grapes or raisins. 4They’re not to eat anything a grapevine produces from seeds to skin.

5During that time, they have to let their hair grow. 6-7They can’t make themselves ceremonially unclean by going near a dead body even for a parent or sibling that dies. [8] Num 6:1-8 9“If someone dies suddenly beside them and defiles their dedicated head, they’ll shave it the same day and on the seventh day. 10The eighth day, they’ll take two turtledoves or young pigeons to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting. 11The priest will offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering; that will purify them from their defilement. That same day they’ll reconsecrate their head, 12dedicate to Yahveh their days as a Nazirite, and take a male lamb a year old for a guilt offering. Their previous days of separation are void.

item.title: Numbers 7
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 7

1The day Moses finished setting up the Tabernacle, he anointed and consecrated its furnishings, the altar, and its utensils. 2The leaders in Israel (besides the numbered men) made an offering 3and brought it to the Tabernacle: 6 covered carts

and 12

cattle, a cart for each pair of leaders and an ox for each leader. 4Yahveh told Moses, 5“Accept these things for use in the Tent of Meeting. Give them to each Levite according to his service.” 6Moses accepted the carts and cattle and gave them to the Levites: 72 carts and 4 cattle to Gershon’s descendants to match their service, 8and 4 carts and 8 cattle to Merari’s descendants to match their service—as directed by Ithamar Ben-Aaron. 9He didn’t give any to Kohath’s descendants because their service was with the holy objects, which they carried on their shoulders. 10The leaders offered the dedication offering for the altar when it was anointed; they offered it in front of the altar. Num 7:1-10

1Then Yahveh told Moses, “Have them present their offering, one leader a day, for the dedication of the altar.” [Each leader presented the same offering as follows:]

item.title: Numbers 8
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 8

1Yahveh told Moses 2to have Aaron put up

the 7

lamps to shine in front of the lampstand. 3Aaron did that. 4The lampstand was hammered gold from its base to its flowers in the pattern Yahveh showed Moses. Num 8:1-4 The Levites Dedicated

5Again Yahveh told Moses, 6“Take the Levites from among the Israelites and cleanse them. 7For their cleansing, sprinkle purifying water on them, have them shave their whole bodies and wash their clothes. 8Then have them take a bull with its grain offering—fine flour mixed with olive oil. Take a second bull for a sin offering. 9Present the Levites at the Tent of Meeting and gather the community. 10Have them put their hands on the Levites. 11Then Aaron will present the Levites to Yahveh as a wave offering from the people to qualify them to perform service to Yahveh. 12The Levites will put their hands on the bulls’ heads. They’ll offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, to atone for the Levites. 13Have the Levites stand in the presence of Aaron and his sons to present them as a wave offering to Yahveh.

item.title: Numbers 9
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 9

1In the first month, second year after the Israelites left Egypt, Yahveh told Moses in the Wilderness of Sinai, 2-3“Have Israel observe Passover as directed at its scheduled time: the fourteenth day of this month in the evening.” 4Moses told the Israelites to observe it. 5They did so in the Wilderness of Sinai the way Yahveh commanded Moses.

Num 9:1-5

6Some men were ceremonially unclean because of a corpse, so they couldn’t observe it that day. They came to Moses and Aaron that day, 7“Although we’re unclean, why can’t we present the offering to Yahveh at the scheduled time with the rest of Israel?”

item.title: Numbers 10
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 10

1Yahveh told Moses, 2“Make two bugles out of hammered silver. Use them to gather the community or move the camp out. 3Blow both bugles to gather the community at the Tent of Meeting. 4Blow one bugle to gather just the leaders of thousands there. 5“When you blow the signal, the camps pitched on the east side will set out. 6When you blow the signal again, the camps pitched on the south side will set out. 7When assembling the community, however, blow without sounding an alarm. 8By permanent statute the priestly descendants of Aaron will blow the bugles. 9When you go to war in your country against an attacker, blow the signal with the bugle, so Yahveh will remember you and save you from your enemies. 10At celebrations, at scheduled festivals, and on the first day of the month, blow the bugles over your burnt offerings and peace offerings to remind your God about you. I’m Yahveh your God.”

item.title: Numbers 11
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 11

111:1The people started complaining about their hardships. Yahveh’s anger flared. It burned among them and burned up the outskirts of the camp. 2The people cried out to Moses, and he prayed to Yahveh, and the fire died down. 3The name of that place became Taberah, because Yahveh’s fire “burned” among them.

4Some riffraff among them had selfish interests and cried out again, “Who’s going to feed us? 5We remember the fish we used to eat free in Egypt, the cucumbers, melons, leeks, onions, and garlic. 6Now our appetite’s gone. There’s nothing to look at except this manna.”

item.title: Numbers 12
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 12

1Miriam and Aaron criticized Moses for the Nubian woman he’d married. 2“Has Yahveh indeed only spoken through you? Hasn’t he spoken through us too?” Yahveh heard it. (3Moses was the humblest man in the world.) 4At once, Yahveh told Moses, Aaron, and Miriam, “Come out to the Tent of Meeting.” 5He came down in a pillar of cloud and stood at the entrance to the Tent to call Aaron and Miriam. When they’d come forward, 6he said, “Listen to what I’m saying: if there’s a prophet among you, I’ll show myself to him in a vision or speak to him in a dream.

item.title: Numbers 13
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 13

13:1Yahveh told Moses, 2“Send one leader from each tribe to spy out Canaan that I’m giving to Israel.”

3Moses sent out these leaders from Paran:

4from Reuben, Shammua Ben-Zaccur;

5from Simeon, Shaphat Ben-Hori;

6from Judah, Caleb Ben-Jephunneh;

7from Issachar, Igal Ben-Joseph;

8from Ephraim, Hoshea Ben-Nun, (16bthat Moses called Joshua);

9from Benjamin, Palti Ben-Raphu;

10from Zebulun, Gaddiel Ben-Sodi;

11from Joseph, tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi Ben-Susi;

12from Dan, Ammiel Ben-Gemalli;

item.title: Numbers 14
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 14

1The community cried out loud that night 2and complained to Moses and Aaron, “We should’ve died in Egypt! We should’ve died in the desert! 3Why is Yahveh taking us to this land to fall by the sword? Our wives and little ones will become spoils of war. Wouldn’t we be better off to go back to Egypt?”

4They said to one another, “Let’s appoint a leader and go back.”

item.title: Numbers 15
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 15

-2Yahveh told Moses to tell Israel, “When you go into the land I’m giving you, 3make a burnt offering to meY—a sacrifice to fulfill a special vow, a free-will offering, at your scheduled times. Make a pleasing aroma from the herd or flock. 4“When you present your offering, present a grain offering made from .11 bushel .1 ephah of fine flour mixed with 3 pints ¼ hin of olive oil. 5Prepare wine for the liquid offering, 3 pints ¼ hin, with the burnt offering or sacrifice, for each lamb. 6“For a ram, prepare as a grain offering .22 bushel .2 ephah of fine flour mixed with ⅓⅓ him of olive oil. 7For a liquid offering, offer ⅓ gallon ⅓ hin of wine as an aroma pleasing to Yahveh.

item.title: Numbers 16
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 16

1Korah Ben-Izhar Ben-Kohath Ben-Levi, along with Dathan and Abiram sons of Eliab and On Ben-Peleth (descendants of Reuben)—2together with 250 prominent chosen leaders of the community, well-known men chosen by the assembly—rebelled against Moses and some of the people. 3They gathered against Moses and Aaron, and said, “You’ve gone far enough. The whole community is holy, every one of them, and Yahveh’s among them. Why place yourselves above Yahveh’s assembly?”

item.title: Numbers 17
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 17

1Yahveh said to Moses, 2“Tell the Israelites to get a rod from each family leader. Write each man’s name on his rod 3and write Aaron’s name on Levi’s rod. 4Then put them in the Tent of Meeting in front of the Testimony where I meet you. 5The rod of the man I choose will sprout. I’ll stifle the criticism of your critics.

6Moses told the Israelites to give him a rod for each family leader (12 rods) with Aaron’s rod among them. 7Moses put the rods in front of Yahveh in the Tent of Testimony.

item.title: Numbers 18
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 18

1So Yahveh told Aaron, “You, your sons, and your father’s family will be responsible for the sanctuary. You and your sons will be responsible for the priesthood. 2But take your relatives from the tribe of Levi to help you while you and your sons serve in the Tent of Testimony. 3They’ll make preparations throughout the Tent, but they can’t approach the sanctuary furnishings or the altar, or they and you will die. 4An outsider can’t come near you. 5They’ll tend to preparations for the sanctuary and the altar so there won’t be any more anger on Israel. 6I’ll give your fellow Levites to you, dedicated to Yahveh, to service the Tent of Meeting. 7But you and your sons will tend to everything around the altar and inside the curtain. I’m giving you the priesthood as a service; execute any outsider that comes near.”

item.title: Numbers 19
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 19

1Yahveh told Moses and Aaron, 2“This is a statute of Yahveh, ‘Tell the Israelites to bring you an unblemished red heifer that’s never worn a yoke. 3Give it to Eleazar to take outside the camp and slaughter in his presence. 4He’ll take some of its blood with his finger and sprinkle it toward the front of the Tent of Meeting seven times. 5Then the heifer will be burned in front of him—hide, meat, blood, and refuse. 6The priest will take cedar wood, hyssop, and scarlet material, and throw it onto the burning heifer. 7Then he’ll wash his clothes, take a bath, and afterward come into the camp, but he’ll be ceremonially unclean till evening. 8The one that burns it will also wash his clothes, take a bath, and be unclean till evening. 9A man that’s clean will gather the heifer’s ashes and deposit them outside the camp in a clean place, and the community will keep it as water for removing impurity from sin. 10The one that gathers the ashes will wash his clothes and be unclean till evening. A permanent statute for Israelites and foreigners living among them.

item.title: Numbers 20
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 20

1The whole community came to the Wilderness of Zin in the first month and stayed at Kadesh. Miriam died and they buried her there. Moses Strikes the Rock

2The community didn’t have water and gathered against Moses and Aaron, 3“If only we’d perished when our relatives perished in Yahveh’s presence! 4Why bring hisY assembly into this desert for us and our animals to die? 5Why make us come up from Egypt to this wretched place? It’s not a place with grain, figs, grapes, or pomegranates; and there’s no water.”

item.title: Numbers 21
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 21

1When the Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negev, heard that Israel was coming by way of Atharim, he fought Israel and took some captives. 2Israel vowed to Yahveh, “If you’ll deliver them to me, we’ll destroy their towns.” 3He delivered them, and they “destroyed” them and their towns; the name of the place became Hormah.

Num 21:1-3

The Bronze Snake

4Then they set out from Mount Hor by taking the road to the Red Sea, to go around Edom, and the people got impatient because of the journey. 5They criticized God and Moses, “Why bring us out of Egypt to die in the desert? There’s no food or water. We hate this miserable food!” 6Yahveh sent poisonous snakes among them. They bit the people and a lot of them died. 7They came to Moses, “We’ve sinned; we’ve criticized you and Yahveh. Intercede with him so he’ll take the snakes away.” Moses did that, 8and Yahveh told him, “Fashion a poisonous snake on a standard so everybody that looks at it will survive.” 9Moses did that. If a snake bit anyone and they looked at the bronze serpent, they’d survive.

item.title: Numbers 22
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 22

1Israel traveled and camped in the plains of Moab across the Jordan from Jericho. 2Balak Ben-Zippor saw what Israel did to the Amorites. 3The people of Moab were afraid of them because there were so many of them. 4The king of Moab told the elders in Midian, “This horde will eat up everything around us like an ox eats up grass in a pasture.” Balak, king of Moab at the time, 5sent messengers to Balaam Ben-Beor at Pethor, near the River Euphrates in the land of his people. He called him and said, “A people has come out of Egypt. They cover the ground; they’re living across from me. 6Come and put a curse on them; there are too many of them for me to fight. Maybe I can defeat them and drive them out. I know that whoever you bless is blessed, and whoever you curse is cursed.”

item.title: Numbers 23
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 23

1Then Balaam told Balak, “Build seven altars for me here and prepare seven bulls and rams.” 2They offered a bull and a ram on each altar. 3Balaam told him, “Stand beside your burnt offering, and I’ll go. Maybe Yahveh will come to me, and I’ll tell you what he shows me.” He went to a bare hill. 4God met him, and he said, “I’ve set up seven altars and offered a bull and a ram on each one.” 5Yahveh gave Balaam a message, “Go tell Balak such and such.” 6He went back to Balak, who was standing by his burnt offering with the leaders of Moab.

item.title: Numbers 25
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 25

1While Israel was camping in Shittim, the people started carrying on prostitution with the women of Moab. 2They invited the people to the sacrifices to their gods, and the people ate and bowed to their gods. 3In this way, Israel joined themselves to Baal of Peor, and Yahveh was angry. 4He told Moses, “Seize the ringleaders and execute them in broad daylight in myY presence so my fierce anger will turn away from Israel.” 5Moses told the judges, “Each of you put to death his men that have joined in worshiping Baal of Peor.”

item.title: Numbers 26
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 26

1After the plague Yahveh told Moses and Eleazar, 2“Count by families the men 20 years old and up that can go to war.” 3Moses and Eleazar told them in the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho, 4“Count the men 20 years old and up.” The Israelites that came out of Egypt were as follows:

5Reuben by families was Hanoch, Pallu, 6-7Hezron, and Carmi: 43,730

item.title: Numbers 27
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 27

1The daughters of Zelophehad Ben-Hepher (Ben-Gilead Ben-Machir Ben-Manasseh) Ben-Joseph came near: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah. 2They stood in front of Moses, Eleazar, and the leaders of the community at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, and said, 3“Our father died in the wilderness, but not among those who opposed Yahveh with Korah. He died in his own sin and didn’t have any sons. 4Why should he disappear from his clan just because he didn’t have any sons? Give us a possession among our father’s brothers.”

item.title: Numbers 28
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 28

-2Yahveh told Moses to tell Israel, “Present my offerings by fire at their scheduled times, an aroma pleasing to me, my ‘food.’ 3Make this offering by fire to Yahveh every day: 2 male lambs a year old without defect. 4Offer one in the morning, the other in the evening. 5For a grain offering, offer .11 bushel .1 ephah of fine flour mixed with 3 pints ¼ hin of pressed olive oil. 6It’s a daily burnt offering that was ordained at Mount Sinai. 7The liquid offering that goes with it will be 3 pints ¼ hin of alcohol for each lamb, poured out in the Holy Place. 8Offer the other lamb that evening the same way with its grain offering and liquid offering.

item.title: Numbers 29
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 29

1“The first day, seventh month, hold a holy convocation; don’t work. Celebrate the Festival of Trumpets. 2Offer a burnt offering as an aroma pleasing to Yahveh: 1 bull, 1 ram, and 7 male lambs a year old without defect. 3Offer with them their grain offerings of fine flour mixed with olive oil—.3 of a measure for the bull, .2 for the ram, 4and .1 for each lamb. 5Offer 1 male goat for a sin offering to atone for yourselves. 6Offer them in addition to the burnt offering at the new moon and its grain offering, and the daily burnt offering and its grain offering. Offer their liquid offerings.

item.title: Numbers 30
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 30

1Then Moses told the tribal leaders, “This is what Yahveh has commanded. 2If a man makes a vow to Yahveh or takes an oath that obligates him to do something, he must keep his word. Women’s Vows

3If a woman takes a vow to Yahveh and obligates herself to do something while in her father’s family in her youth, 4and her father hears it and doesn’t object, then her vow or pledge stands. 5But if her father forbids her, her vow and pledge don’t stand. Yahveh will release her from them because her father forbade her. 6“But, if she marries while under her vow or rash statement 7and her husband hears about it and doesn’t object, then her vow or pledge stands. 8But, if he forbids her, he annuls her vow or rash statement, and Yahveh will release her from it. 9“The vow of a widow or divorced woman stands.

item.title: Numbers 31
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 31

1Yahveh told Moses, 2“Take revenge for Israel on the Midianites. Afterward you’ll pass on to your people.”

3Moses told the people, “Arm men to attack Midian and carry out Yahveh’s revenge on it. 4Send 1,000 men from each tribe.”

5They pro

vided 12

,000 men. 6Moses sent them to war with Phinehas Ben-Eleazar the priest along with the holy items from the sanctuary and bugles for signaling. 7They fought Midian and killed every male, 8including its five kings: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, Reba. They also killed Balaam Ben-Beor with a sword. 9They took the women and children, their cattle, flocks, and possessions. 10They burned their towns, houses, and camps; 11and took the spoil—people and animals. 12They brought the captives, prey, and spoil to Moses, Eleazar, and the community on the plains of Moab across the Jordan from Jericho. Num 31:1-12

13Moses, Eleazar, and the leaders of the community met them outside the camp. 14Moses was mad at the officers of the army and the commanders of thousands and hundreds. 15“You’ve saved the women alive? 16They’re what got Israel to sin against Yahveh at Peor, and a plague came into the community by Balaam’s advice. 17So kill every male child and every woman that has had intercourse with a man. 18Keep alive for yourselves the young girls that are virgins. 19Camp outside the camp for a week. Whoever has killed anybody or touched a slain body, purify yourself on the third day and seventh day, you and your captives. 20Purify every piece of clothing, anything made out of skin, goat hair, or wood.”

item.title: Numbers 32
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 32

1Reuben and Gad had lots of livestock. When they saw that Jazer and Gilead had good grazing land, 2they spoke to Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the leaders of the community, 3“Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon—4land Yahveh overthrew for Israel—is suitable for our livestock. 5If we’re pleasing to you, give us this land instead of having us cross the Jordan.”

6Moses said, “Will your relatives go to war, and you sit here? 7Why discourage Israel from going to the land Yahveh has given them? 8That’s what your fathers did when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to spy out the land. 9When they went to the Valley of Eshcol and saw the land, they discouraged Israel from going in. 10Yahveh was angry that day and swore, 11‘No men that came up from Egypt 20 years and older will see the land I promised Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, because they wouldn’t follow me. 12Only Caleb the Kenizzite and Joshua Ben- Nun faithfully followed me.’ 13Yahveh made Israel wander in the desert for 40 years till that generation died off. 14You’re replacing your parents as sinful people to anger Yahveh toward Israel. 15If you turn aside from him, he’ll leave you in the desert. You’ll be responsible for destroying this nation.”

item.title: Numbers 33
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 33

1These are the segments of the journey Israel took when they left Egypt. 2Yahveh told Moses to write them down. 3They traveled from Rameses on the fifteenth day, first month, the day after Passover. They left right in front of the Egyptians 4while they were burying the firstborn that Yahveh struck. Yahveh also carried out judgments against their gods.

Num 33:1-4

4in Rephidim, where there was no water to drink.

item.title: Numbers 34
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 34

1-2Yahveh told Moses to say to Israel, “When you go into Canaan, 3your south border will run from the Wilderness of Zin alongside Edom from the end of the Dead Sea eastward. 4Your border will turn from the south to the ascent of Akrabbim and go on along to Zin. It will end south of Kadesh-barnea, go out to Hazaraddar, and on along to Azmon. 5The border will turn from Azmon to where the River of Egypt empties into the Mediterranean Sea.

item.title: Numbers 35
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 35

1In the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho, Yahveh said to Moses, 2“Tell Israel to give the Levites towns to live in, 3along with pastureland for their cattle, herds, and animals. 4The pastures will extend 1500ft out from the wall all around the city, 5a 3,000ft diameter of pastureland. 6Give the Levites 6 cities as refuge for a person to flee to that’s killed someone accidentally. 7Give them 42 other towns with their pastures to make 48 total. 8The towns you give them will be in proportion to the number of towns each tribe inherits.”

item.title: Numbers 36
item.description:
Numbers Chapter 36

1The heads of clans came down from Gilead (Ben-Machir Ben-Manasseh Ben-Joseph) to Moses and Israel’s leaders. 2They said, “Yahveh told you to allot land to Israel for inheritance, and to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our relative to his daughters. 3But if they marry outside their tribe, their inheritance will move to the new tribe. 4When Israel’s Year of Jubilee comes, it will become permanent in the new tribe and lost from ours.”
